attributes.action: Allow HM Armed forces to be able to vote at their current base UK or worldwide.
attributes.background: Due to the busy and unpredictable nature of their jobs Service personnel have found it difficult to vote in person or by post/proxy and often don't get to have their say on matters and the things that ultimately effect their careers, families and their country they are proud to serve.

attributes.action: Make BBC Parliament exempt from the TV licencing requirements
attributes.background: It is ridiculous at best, and undemocratic at worst, that in order to watch our elected representatives at work we're required to pay the BBC a licence fee. Whilst the argument is understandable for other BBC services, we should not have to pay to watch the democratic process of our country at work.

attributes.action: For ALL EU Protected Sites & Species to carry on being so even if not in the EU
attributes.background: We have various species and sites in the UK that are currently protected by EU law.  We must ensure that these continue to be protected within the UK even if we are no longer part of the European Union due to the result of the recent democratic vote.
attributes.additional_details:
A few links to various species and sites that are currently protected: 
http://jncc.defra.gov.uk/page-1747
https://www.gov.uk/topic/environmental-management/wildlife-habitat-conservation

attributes.action: Accept Functional Skills as an equivalent qualification for EYE's Level 3
attributes.background: I am very concerned about the negative impact of the Government’s decision that all Level 3 Early Years Educators must have at least a C grade in GCSE English and maths with no equitable alternative such as Functional Skills allowed.
attributes.additional_details: Your policy will mean there will be a significant shortfall in the number of Level 3 childcare practitioners, which threatens the quality of care that children will get in early years settings.

attributes.action: Verify the quantum of EU Referendum votes made on the basis of lies & untruths
attributes.background: The 23 June 2016 EU Referendum, has set a path for the UK which is likely to cause significant damage to the economy and send the UK into recession. It has emerged that many voters cast their votes on the basis of lies, untruths and misrepresentation of facts by both the Leave & Remain campaigns.
attributes.additional_details:
Following the Leave and Remain Campaigns backtracking on the various promises and statements that they made to the electorate,  the leading polling consultants have now determined that many voters cast their votes on the basis of these claims that have now been proven to be lies and untruths and many voters have confirmed they would now cast their votes differently.

The Government needs to determine if this sample is statistically relevant and if it could have affected the outcome of the result

attributes.action: A highly experienced business figure should lead UK exit negotiations with EU
attributes.background: Given the extreme importance of negotiating the best possible exit for the UK from the EU, the government should employ the services of a highly experienced, independent business figure to lead & manage the negotiations. We need the best person for the job who is unlikely to be a politician.

attributes.action: CHANGE THE LAW TO PROTECT ANIMALS FROM THREATS OF VIOLENCE AND DEATH FROM PEOPLE
attributes.background: Animal protection laws need to be change so it become illegal for people to threaten to kill someones animals.
attributes.additional_details: As it stands at the moment it is not a criminal offence to tell people that they will kill your animals and they can get away with with completely until they have caused harm to the animal. We need to have this changed so that people will get some kind of criminal conviction for threatening peoples animals.

attributes.action: Remove all religious representatives from any Parliamentary institution.
attributes.background: Our Government should be 100% secular and should have no religious bias from any religious group. This means removing The Lords Spiritual from the House of Lords and removing any religious ceremony or act from any part of Parliamentary processes.
attributes.additional_details: The lack of secularism in our society promotes inequality through the definition of people and organisations by their affiliation to religious institutions. To combat inequality, our Political Leaders must be independent of all religious influence, irrespective of the religion, so that all decisions can be made in a fair and balanced way. This independence cannot be accomplished whilst we have members of one religious institution in Parliament in any form.

attributes.action: Brexit negotiations to promote a strong & collaborative relationship with the EU
attributes.background: Sixteen million people voted to Remain. The views of these people and the weight of their opinion must be reflected in Brexit negotiations. The negotiation team must focus on forging a strong, collaborative and balanced working relationship with the EU, and be made up accordingly.
attributes.additional_details:
I was vehemently for Remain, and now I am determined that Brexit is made to mean healthy collaboration with the EU on new terms (and terms that the Northern Ireland and Scotland can support as part of the UK) rather than a soapbox for nationalistic rhetoric!

Britain may have voted out, but it clearly and emphatically does not want away. Most importantly, Brexit does not (and will not) mean embracing the Farage and Le Pen view of the world!

It is hope the EU will help us make this happen.

attributes.action: Allow Tunbridge Wells a referendum to separate from the UK alongside Scotland.
attributes.background:
Tunbridge Wells voted in favour of remaining as part of the EU against the trend of the rest of the country.

Please allow Tunbridge Wells an independence referendum (along the lines of the inevitable Scottish Referendum for independence) so that it can renegotiate itself back into the EU.

attributes.action: Repeal Scotland Act 1998 and 2016 Amendments and dissolve Holyrood
attributes.background: On 26th June First Minister Nicola Sturgeon threatened to veto UK succession from the EU despite the country voting by over 1.2 million votes to leave. Such action is in contravention to democratic will. Westminster should reverse Scottish devolution to prevent the SNP's constitutional overreach

attributes.action: We need a Government of National Unity elected by Proportional Representation.
attributes.background: Solving the EU withdrawal problems will require help from the best of politicians, regardless of their political persuasions. With Proportional Representation every vote will again count and every voter's interest will be protected.

attributes.action: Give young people of 13 years and over the right to vote in referenda.
attributes.background: I am 13.  People of my age will have to live with the decisions that adults made for us for years to come.  We need a say.  Young people are just as engaged as adults.  We have access to social media and information, and we take it in.  We want to secure our own futures.

attributes.action: Petition for a referendum to decide on a 2nd British referendum on EU membership
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to implement a referendum to decide on whether another EU referendum will take place. If the yes vote is more than 60%, then a second EU referendum, also with a 60% majority threshold requirement for the winning side, should be held.

attributes.action: Raise the age of voting to 25
attributes.background: It would appear that too many young people between the ages of 18 and 25 are being persuaded about their political decisions by uneducated pop stars and celebrities. therefore only persons over 25 should have the political mandate.
attributes.additional_details:
Bob Geldorf, had a few hit records and now extols the advantages of remaining in the EU. With no expertise in how the EU works or any political office of his own. is also not a British citizen

Bono, had some hit records and now extols the advantages of remaining in the EU. With no expertise in how the EU works or any political office of his own. is also not a British citizen

attributes.action: Increase NHS and science research funding by £350 million per week
attributes.background: The leave campaign promised to redirect the money spent on EU membership to UK priorities, such as NHS and science funding. They should honour this promise, and increase funding for the NHS and science research by £350 million per week, which is what is spent by the UK on EU membership.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.voteleavetakecontrol.org/campaign - evidence that voters were promised increased funding for the NHS and science research by the leave campaign.

attributes.action: Referendum on making London a principality with right to remain in the EU
attributes.background: Following the overwhelming support from London voters for the UK to remain in the EU, we request that HM Government consider the option to allow London (as a principality of the U.K.) to remain in the EU - if necessary, following a second referendum/London-only vote.

attributes.action: Make London, Northern Ireland and Scotland an independent EU state.
attributes.background: The Majority of Scotland, Northern Ireland and London have voted to remain in the UK. So I ask Parliament to hold a referendum to make London Northern Ireland and Scotland a separate state of the European Union.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence as per EU Referendum results in press.

attributes.action: Allow the area within the M25 to secede from the UK and remain part of the EU.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, believe the results of the EU referendum highlight irreconcilable differences between those living within the M25 and those outside of it.  Accordingly, we wish to secede from the UK so that we can have our (sane) vote to remain part of the EU respected.
attributes.additional_details: We invite those areas of the UK that voted to remain to join us and become part of a new commonwealth of the enlightened.

attributes.action: Create new Special Economic Zone for London, NI & Scotland which remains in EU
attributes.background: Although a majority of the UK voted to leave the EU a large majority of those in London, NI and Scotland voted to remain. These areas will suffer the most from the UK leaving the EU. Special Economic Zones have been created in many countries, including China, with much success.
attributes.additional_details:
We know the EU isn't perfect and needs radical reform but for many in the UK that doesn't mean we should leave it. This petition requests that the creation of a Special Economic Zone is discussed in Parliament. This Zone would remain a member of the EU and contain London, and perhaps other interested contiguous regions.

This SEZ would enable these regions to continue trading from within the EU thereby fostering increased trade, investment and job creation.

attributes.action: Bristol to receive a referendum to leave the UK and form an independent Nation
attributes.background: After vote leave won we believe that the United Kingdom does not speak or represent Bristol anymore and believe it better to move in a different direction from the UK

attributes.action: Call for an enquiry into false claims & advertising used in the EU Referendum
attributes.background: Both sides used false advertising and claims during the EU Referendum. It made for a completely confusing debate and made it extremely hard for the electorate to follow, and therefore tough to make an informed decision.

attributes.action: A referendum for Independence for London, and the South East England Counties.
attributes.background: On the 23rd of June 2016 the United Kingdom voted to leave the EU. London & South East of England thrive on European trade and intrinsic links to global wealth and trade that it brings.
attributes.additional_details: On the 23rd of June 2016 the United Kingdom held a referendum to on Europe. The local economies of "L&SE" (London and the South East) are driven by our intrinsic links to global trade and global wealth, and services to be provided around this. The EU is a vital component of these links.

attributes.action: Bring the perpetrators of rape in the Democratic Republic of Congo to justice.
attributes.background:
Young girls and I mean young [under 5 in some cases] are being taken from their homes gang rapped and then left. 

I would like the UK to put pressure on the Congo offering police help if needed to stop this wave of rape and oppression of young girls.
attributes.additional_details:
You can see the story here
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/jun/20/girls-gang-raped-suspects-free-democratic-republic-congo-president-kabila?CMP=share_btn_fb

attributes.action: Have all religious institutions in the UK declare their source of funding.
attributes.background: In wake of the countless terror attacks occurring on European soil, the issue of radicalisation of people in the UK is an increasingly important issue. To help combat this issue all religious institutions should declare where they receive their funding and who the recipients of their charity are.
attributes.additional_details:
After sources revealing the situation in Germany regarding approximately 200 mosques offered to be built by the Saudi Government (one I find deplorable in how it acts), I feel that it is time to see where mosques in Great Britain get their funding from and where their charity goes and whether it goes to funding extremism or not.

This petition also applies to religious institutions of other faiths as this is more than possible.

attributes.action: When a minor offence becomes 'spent', remove it from a person's enhanced DBS.
attributes.background: When I was young, I got into trouble with the police which resulted in a criminal record; these were minor offences. All my convictions are now spent but they still show up on an enhanced DBS check which makes it difficult to find alternative employment.We shouldn't be judged by juvenile mistakes.
attributes.additional_details: After a search online, it became apparent that this issue is common. There are many skilled and qualified people who are more than capable of doing there job but employers won't take the risk because of a document which states information from 5, 10, 15 even 30 years ago.

attributes.action: Make cycling on a footway an arrestable offence and raise the fine to £1,000.
attributes.background: It is a criminal offence in England and Wales to cycle on footways such as pavements, walkways and foot bridges. The current penalty for this is a measly £50 fine despite the danger to pedestrians.  Cycling on footways should be arrestable, the fine increased to £1,000 and cycles seized until paid.
attributes.additional_details:
With the popularity of cycling in the UK on the up, the numbers of people regularly committing offences such as cycling on the pavement is also increasing. Research has shown that cyclists now represent almost as much danger to pedestrians as motorists do, that the injuries inflicted can be as damaging and nearly 100 people in the UK are killed by cyclists each year.

Making this offence arrestable and increasing the fine will act as a better deterrent and improve pedestrian safety.

attributes.action: Create a separate loan that caters for accommodation for university students
attributes.background: Many student loans barely cover the cost of accommodation, so how will students from low income families go to the university of their choice when accommodation is more than the loan they are entitled to? This leaves many students in a deficit before they've even paid for anything.
attributes.additional_details: With an extra loan that caters for accommodation students will not have debt on their shoulders as soon as they start university, and can start focusing on more important things like the education itself. If grants are scrapped, at least bring something new and realistic to the table? This way less students will be tied between going to university or not because of the expenses, and will have easier access to a higher education letting students from 'low income families' have a better chance.

attributes.action: To introduce lessons on taxation and British law into the national curriculum.
attributes.background: I believe that as a student who will soon be making the change to university life hopefully, I and many others are under prepared for adult life. I also believe that it is vital children know their rights as a British citizen and also the basic laws of Britain.

attributes.action: Introduce realistic maximum time for DBS applications for people trying to work.
attributes.background: DBS disclosures are needed to protect vulnerable people, yet thousands of people with families are waiting months to start a job they have been offered. This causes detrimental effects to peoples health and well being and in some cases homelessness.
attributes.additional_details:
These stresses and strains caused to peoples livelihoods need to be dramatically reduced. Many people are waiting over 5 months (in some cases over 7) uncertain of when they can financially support themselves and their families.
Many applications made to the DBS are for roles within the health and social care sector, increasingly under pressure through lack of staff. 
The government should also consider that such delays in peoples wages also directly impacts upon income tax payments.

attributes.action: Petrol stations must offer the option to purchase fuel with a CO2 offset eg +1p
attributes.background: Driving my car contributes to global warming because burning fuel produces CO2. I would happily choose to pay an extra penny or so to offset my carbon, for example, by planting a tree. We will empower every driver to make a difference and show that Britain can lead the world in CO2 reduction.
attributes.additional_details:
It is very difficult for ordinary people to reduce the amount of CO2 that they produce. I have to heat my house in winter, drive to work and I like to go on holiday somewhere warm. Although I can reduce my consumption a bit, I can't reduce it enough to make a difference on my own. However if I work with other people I can make a difference.

 "Carbon offsetting" allows me to pay other people to reduce their CO2 emissions and "offset" my own. Here are some examples of offsetting projects https://www.bptargetneutral.com/uk/our-projects/a-global-portfolio/

attributes.action: Free dental & optical treatment inc free glasses for diabetics.
attributes.background: Myself and other people who suffer from diabetes know the complications we suffer with our dental and eyesight problems, Causing very uncomfortable pain and strain. We are constantly paying huge bills to our dentists and opticians on a regular Basis for treatment we need, that we cannot prevent.
attributes.additional_details:
Diabetes is the leading cause of blindness in adults aged 20 to 74. High blood sugar which cannot always be prevented causes the lens of the eye to swell, which changes our ability to see.
Gum disease is much more common In a person who suffers from diabetes, this is because the red blood cells cannot fight infection as well as a non sufferer, causing pain and in time, brittle teeth. This in turn forces us to visit the dentist a lot more often than the average person.

attributes.action: All lorries that come into Dover should be checked
attributes.background: Some lorries are allowed into the country without being checked for illegal immigrants or narcotics and this should not be the case. All lorries should be checked in order to reduce the amount of illegal immigrants that are allowed into the country.

attributes.action: Exemption of the 3% tax levy on parents helping their children to buy a home.
attributes.background: Helping children to buy homes should not be taxed. The money being used by parents has already been taxed twice as salary and as savings. This law is morally corrupt.

attributes.action: Stop increasing the pension age.  Reverse it back to 62 and 67 now.
attributes.background: Action is urgently required.  there are few of us who feel able to work in their late 60's/mid 70's especially if their jobs have been stressful or physical.  Just how are we supposed to keep going and who is going to employ us.  Reverse this increase back to 62 and 67 now

attributes.action: Make it illegal for pension funds to be plundered.
attributes.background: Once again an "entrepreneur" has plundered the pension fund of many working people - this time British Home Stores.  The shortfall will have to be met by the British Taxpayer while the "entrepreneur" walks away.
attributes.additional_details: When Robert Maxwell, another "entrepreneur", plundered pension funds  years ago there was a public outcry but nothing has been done to prevent this happening again.  Why not?  Pension funds should be ring-fenced so that they cannot be plundered.  The money which will have to be found to meet this pension gap would be spent better on doctors, nurses, the NHS in general, better treatment of the older generation and many other causes. Meanwhile the person responsible for this walks away.

attributes.action: Make an INDEPENDENT EU booklet - facts, figures, forecasts if we STAY + if we GO
attributes.background: The EU Referendum is producing a blizzard of numbers, claims, guesses - it is virtually impossible for voters to assess properly the facts as they stand, or to get a balanced set of forecasts on the implications of either result. Without this information, the public cannot be asked to make a choice.
attributes.additional_details:
An independently produced booklet, perhaps no bigger the governments already produced booklet on why we should vote to stay, can be quickly produced to present first the facts as they stand and then the general expert views on what are the implications for the country if we vote to stay and if we vote to go.
Without giving voters a proper opportunity to assess both the facts and the body of opinion for both options in order to make their informed choice, we undermine democracy itself.

attributes.action: Ban smoking outside pubs,restaurants and cafes to make a smoke-free Britain
attributes.background: We need to ban this because when people like to sit outside a restaurant in the summer if they do not smoke they do not want anyone smoking outside when they are eating the food.
attributes.additional_details: when you are just coming  in the a pub you do not want people outside smoking when you come you mind not want to go in the pub at the end.

attributes.action: stop medicines wastage, allow the re-use of returned medication to the  pharmacy
attributes.background: Every year millions of pounds is lost when medications are returned to the pharmacy for destruction by patients, care homes e.t.c. Some of the medication remains untouched. We have the ridiculous situation where medication that has left the premises and returned the next day has to be destroyed.
attributes.additional_details: The government should allow pharmaceutical bodies to have criteria which can be followed to allow some medication that has to be returned to pharmacies to be re-used thus saving millions of pounds firstly in destruction costs and secondly in the cost of the medication. In light of the recent financial crisis and the cash strapped NHS. These efficiency savings could be pumped back into the NHS. It is also and unethical scenario when there are people around the globe who cannot afford medications.

attributes.action: Scrap the proposed tax on individual landlords with mortgages
attributes.background: I have worked all my life and  do not have a pension (like George Osbourne), I bought a small property for the future so I wont be a burden on the state.
attributes.additional_details: I know everyone will think all landlords are rich but we simply are not Im just trying to provide an income for when I retire in about ten years and don't think I should be punished for this.

attributes.action: Make all military veterans pensions tax free after a minimum service period
attributes.background: All veterans currently pay income tax on their pensions after full active military service i.e 22 years.  This is then classed as a second income, and other job income taxed accordingly.

attributes.action: Support farmers,pay rural farm payments on time.
attributes.background: This badly organised system has caused suicide within the farming community,disrupting cash flow.
attributes.additional_details: Payment on time: farmers are the salt of the earth:why do we have to suffer, the worry of not being able to pay our debts,last minute decision to inform us: no information as to when payments will be made.Try to get any answers is impossible:

attributes.action: Force all motorcycle delivery riders to pass a full UK motorcycle driving test
attributes.background: Most delivery motorcycle riders are riding on L Plates. i.e. they have not passed a full motorcycle driving test. Their standard of riding is poor and they pose a high risk to other road users/pedestrians. They are using the roads for commercial purposes, they should be forced to pass a driving test

attributes.action: Prevent women from fighting in close combat roles in the British Armed Forces.
attributes.background:
- If a woman wants to serve on the frontline, they need to meet the same physical criteria as men, otherwise lives will be put at risk.
- It would cause discontent among serving members of the armed forces, with many threatening to leave if this becomes policy.
attributes.additional_details:
- Women should not qualify for combat roles with lower physical capabilities, for example they might have to carry a heavy male, with full armour to save his life.

- It would cloud judgement of male counterparts, who would instinctively choose to save a woman if two people's lives were in danger, despite not always being the right decision to take.

- Women, in the main, cannot carry 110lb on their back (as soldiers in Afghanistan did).

- There are already many combat roles open to women.

attributes.action: All police forces and MPs have drug tests every 3 months
attributes.background: Both parties hold high responsibility jobs, If the public can be penalised for it, then so can police forces and MPs, what's good for the goose is good for the gander

attributes.action: Scrap the £9000 tuiton fees!
attributes.background: Students on majority of course are now forced to pay £9000 a year to go and study for their career, a 3/4 year course leaves students with £36,000 debt before their career has even started! Lets fight against this! Many student do even get theres moneys worth or the services they paid for.
attributes.additional_details: The fees for university were £1000 in 1998...how times have changed how can you justify £9000 today?

attributes.action: Teach Creationism (Bible) as a Fact in all State and Academy Schools
attributes.background: This petition is saying that the fact of Biblical creationism should be compulsory in all state and academy schools, and for it to be taught as the fact.
attributes.additional_details: Genesis, which was written around 1,500 BC in the Bible is the truth of God's word, as written by Moses from God's instructions. If we really want to keep the United Kingdom a Christian nation, rather than an atheist nation, we must teach compulsive Creationism in all schools across the UK.

attributes.action: Stop schools forcing children to pray and sing religious songs in assembly.
attributes.background: It is not fair that children, in Primary Schools especially are forced to sing religious songs, hear biblical stories and say prayer in morning assemblies. Even if children are allowed to sit out (e.g. because they have different beliefs) that is encouraging isolation based on religion.

attributes.action: Introduce a temporary visa scheme for refugees
attributes.background: The introduction of a temporary visa scheme would allow safe temporary refuge to people escaping war and persecution. This would allow each case to be reviewed and when circumstances allowed, the refugees could be returned to their home country.  The visa would be granted for up to 3 years.
attributes.additional_details:
Many of our allies in the world use visa systems to control the influx of refugees and immigrants into their countries. It is made perfectly clear that the visa is temporary and this cannot be appealed. The UAE is an example. Visas there are only issued as temporary time limited visit or residency visas. 

In the case of refugees, once the situation is deemed to have improved in their country they return home to re-settle and rebuild their own country. No appeal to stay should be allowed.

attributes.action: Reject the PM's deal: put an option in the referendum to demand a democratic EU.
attributes.background: The PM's deal makes the EU nor more democratic and returns no sovereignty to the 28 states. We must be able to elect EU legislators and executive and be able to remove them. Others of the 28 states within the EU are demanding more democracy and an end to the secret deals struck between bureaucrats.
attributes.additional_details: You might see the DiEM25 site (http://diem25.org) and read some of Yanis Veroufakis' posts for some informative data.  It is not necessary to agree with the solutions, but only to understand the problems.
